meanings.definition: A selection from the Prophets read in synagogue on the Sabbath and holidays.
meanings.sent1: During the service, the rabbi read the haftorot aloud to the congregation.
meanings.sent2: The haftorot are an important part of the weekly synagogue rituals.
meanings.sent3: As the haftorot were being read, a mischievous child giggled in the back of the room.
meanings.sent4: The haunting melodies of the haftorot echoed through the ancient synagogue walls.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the haftorot readings left a lasting impression on the listeners.

meanings.definition: The plural form of haftarah, referring to the readings themselves.
meanings.sent1: In the library, you can find many haftorot from different holidays.
meanings.sent2: The haftorot for this week's service are particularly moving.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed acting out the haftorot as part of their play.
meanings.sent4: The haftorot seemed to dance off the ancient scrolls as they were read.
meanings.sent5: The vivid imagery in the haftorot brought the stories to life for the audience.
